intro: Leontodon eriopus, commonly known as the hairy bellflower, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in grassy areas and open woodlands, preferring well-drained soils. Its flowers are usually pink to purple in color, with a distinctive hairy appearance on the stems and leaves. Leontodon eriopus is often found in mountainous regions and is known for its ornamental value in gardens.
